basics.name: James Benner
basics.label: Web specialist, computer scientist, programmer, open source advocate and geek.
basics.summary: I am constantly researching and implementing new tech and methodologies. I thrive on learning, research, creating great web apps, streamlining UX, automating processes and solving problems.

work.summary: Responsible for DevOps duties including managing & provisioning servers, software deployment and development.  Built upon the fork of an open source CRM while maintaining upstream compatibility.  Acted as a mentor for junior developers.  Implemented multiple facets of The Twelve-Factor App.

Rewrote a core legacy program and reduced memory consumption from 6GB+ to less than 1MB.  Refactored a large legacy codebase and applied SOLID and SoC principles while doubling performance and reducing code complexity.  Architected a system that processed gigabytes of auction information from eBay to perform data science and NLP analysis.

Developed an image deployment system, system backup, and restore utility that powered the nation's largest Microsoft Authorized Refurbisher as well as the Connect2Compete initiative with the FCC. The aforementioned system resulted in less imaging issues and RMAs as well as being faster than our prior solution.  Worked my way through the positions of Technician, Lead Technician, Asset Disposition Coordinator, and Software Configuration Management Technician prior to my formal engineer position.
